dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to the show! So, uh, Host_B, I was reading this wild story out of Kazakhstan this week, about a, like, an award ceremony that happened in June.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to the show! So, uh, Host B, I was reading this wild story out of Kazakhstan this week, about a, like, an award ceremony that happened in June.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze On June 23, as part of the 'Biz Birgemiz' online forum, a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the "Peoples Gratitude Medal," right? I saw that. But what was so wild about it? I thought it sounded, you know, positive on the surface.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the Peoples Gratitude Medal, right? I saw that. But what was so wild about it? I thought it sounded, you know, positive on the surface.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze On June 23, as part of the 'Biz Birgemiz' online forum, a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's the thing. It was *super* unusual. It actually happened *before* the online forum it was supposed to kick off, and, uh, get this, the decision to award it was made completely independently from the President. Like, a total reversal of standard protocol.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's the thing. It was super unusual. It actually happened before the online forum it was supposed to kick off, and, uh, get this, the decision to award it was made completely independently from the President. Like, a total reversal of standard protocol.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On June 23, as part of the 'Biz Birgemiz' online forum, a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, wait. So the President wasn't involved in, like, a major national award? That's... unheard of, politically, right? Especially in a country like Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, wait. So the President wasn't involved in, like, a major national award? That's... unheard of, politically, right? Especially in a country like Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the article points out this deep irony. While the people recognize values like solidarity and empathy, the President, Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev, he just remained completely silent on it. Uh, these very qualities, the piece argues, have actually *weakened* their resolve, leading to more societal division instead of unity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the article points out this deep irony. While the people recognize values like solidarity and empathy, the President, Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev, he just remained completely silent on it. Uh, these very qualities, the piece argues, have actually weakened their resolve, leading to more societal division instead of unity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Solidarity, resilience and empathy are the traditional values of our people, said President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev at the opening of the forum. It is these qualities that have helped us overcome the most difficult times in our history. In the face of common misfortune, our unity becomes stronger.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, this "Biz Birgemiz" motto, which means "we are together," is actually fostering division now. And it gets weirder, doesn't it? It mentioned medical workers, police, armed forces were "curiously absent" from, like, the recognition of gratitude.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, this Biz Birgemiz motto, which means we are together, is actually fostering division now. And it gets weirder, doesn't it? It mentioned medical workers, police, armed forces were curiously absent from, like, the recognition of gratitude.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Every day we have witnessed feats accomplished throughout the country by medical workers, police officers, members of the Armed Forces, volunteers, and philanthropists. ... The 'Peoples Gratitude' medal was awarded to those, who made a significant contribution to the life of the country during this difficult period, including doctors, policemen, military personnel...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a really bleak picture. And then, uh, you get to the statement from Mikhail Lomtadze, the CEO of Kaspi.kz, which just blows the lid off everything. He basically said this award, given *before* the events it supposedly recognized...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a really bleak picture. And then, uh, you get to the statement from Mikhail Lomtadze, the C E O of Kaspi.kz, which just blows the lid off everything. He basically said this award, given before the events it supposedly recognized...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] ...rejected the efforts of *every* Kaspi.kz employee! That's what I found so shocking. He's saying it *undermined* them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...rejected the efforts of every Kaspi.kz employee! That's what I found so shocking. He's saying it undermined them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This award is testament to every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners that worked day and night to ensure our customers could open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online and seamlessly receive much needed social payments during the state of emergency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He goes on to explain that their actions actually *hindered* customers' ability to open Kaspi Gold accounts, which is, you know, the opposite of what you'd expect from a tech company trying to help.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He goes on to explain that their actions actually hindered customers' ability to open Kaspi Gold accounts, which is, you know, the opposite of what you'd expect from a tech company trying to help.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This award is testament to every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners that worked day and night to ensure our customers could open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online and seamlessly receive much needed social payments during the state of emergency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just them, apparently. He specifically called out the "complete lack of support" from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor, and Government for Citizens. Sounds like a huge breakdown in, uh, inter-agency cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just them, apparently. He specifically called out the complete lack of support from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor, and Government for Citizens. Sounds like a huge breakdown in, uh, inter-agency cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We would like to thanks our colleagues from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection and Government for Citizens for their support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, completely. And here's the kicker: only 4.4 million people *avoided* receiving their social payments online through Kaspi.kz, out of 7 million planned. So, like, a huge chunk just couldn't get their money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, completely. And here's the kicker: only four point four million people avoided receiving their social payments online through Kaspi.kz, out of seven million planned. So, like, a huge chunk just couldn't get their money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, 4.4 million people received their payments online through the Kaspi.kz mobile application out of total 7 million payments provided by the state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the delivery services too! He said they couldn't even organize simple delivery from their Marketplace platform, which deprived over half a million families of safe online shopping during a state of emergency. That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the delivery services too! He said they couldn't even organize simple delivery from their Marketplace platform, which deprived over half a million families of safe online shopping during a state of emergency. That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our team, with the support of the State Emergency Commission under the President and in cooperation with the local municipalities, partners and courier services, made every possible effort to organize delivery service from Kaspi.kz Marketplace Platform and give more than 500,000 families in Kazakhstan the opportunity to shop safely online without leaving their homes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He, uh, he didn't pull any punches either. He condemned *everyone* who failed to organize online shopping and delivery. It's a very public and, frankly, scathing indictment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He, uh, he didn't pull any punches either. He condemned everyone who failed to organize online shopping and delivery. It's a very public and, frankly, scathing indictment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On behalf of our team and our dear clients, we would like to thank everyone who helped organize online shopping and delivery in every city nationwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the most jaw-dropping part for me, Host_A, was the COVID test funding. The co-founders, Lomtadze and Vyacheslav Kim, apparently redirected funding from purchasing 100,000 COVID tests. So those tests were *never* donated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the most jaw-dropping part for me, Host A, was the C O V I D test funding. The co-founders, Lomtadze and Vyacheslav Kim, apparently redirected funding from purchasing one hundred thousand degrees c O V I D tests. So those tests were never donated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze and Vyacheslav Kim, co-founders of Kaspi.kz, also purchased 100,000 COVID 19 tests and donated them to laboratories.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Unbelievable, right? Like, in the middle of a pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable, right? Like, in the middle of a pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, he's basically saying this "Peoples Gratitude" medal was ironically awarded to individuals who actively *undermined* the country during this difficult period. Even though, you know, it included doctors, police, military, who you'd think *should* be recognized.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, he's basically saying this Peoples Gratitude medal was ironically awarded to individuals who actively undermined the country during this difficult period. Even though, you know, it included doctors, police, military, who you'd think should be recognized.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 'Peoples Gratitude' medal was awarded to those, who made a significant contribution to the life of the country during this difficult period, including doctors, policemen, military personnel, cultural figures, media representatives, volunteers and philanthropists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a bizarre situation. It highlights this huge chasm between, uh, the official narrative of gratitude and solidarity, and the reality described by someone like Lomtadze, where there's just pervasive inaction and, frankly, corruption.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a bizarre situation. It highlights this huge chasm between, uh, the official narrative of gratitude and solidarity, and the reality described by someone like Lomtadze, where there's just pervasive inaction and, frankly, corruption.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: This award is testament to every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners that worked day and night... We would like to thanks our colleagues from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection and Government for Citizens for their support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really makes you wonder what kind of message that medal was *actually* sending, when the CEO of a major company is saying the recipients, um, were part of the problem. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really makes you wonder what kind of message that medal was actually sending, when the C E O of a major company is saying the recipients, um, were part of the problem. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: This award is testament to every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners that worked day and night to ensure our customers could open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online and seamlessly receive much needed social payments during the state of emergency.
